Issues.Title: Service worker requestSubscription() freezes and doesn't show native popup if serviceworker.controller is null
Issues.Body: # üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/service-worker ### Is this a regression? No ### Description The problem is here https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/a06824aef6e2e1c5b1c037d2c2e1dda544842000/packages/service-worker/src/low_level.ts#L74-L82 When `controllerchange` is triggered, the code access to `serviceworker.controller` and filters it if is `null`. After that, the `registration` is created from the previous pipes. What happens if the `serviceworker.controller` is `null` in all `controllerchange` events? (At the moment you are thinking that couldn't happen, but yes üéâit happens!!!üéâ. Then if the app is started with `serviceworker.controller = null `and `requestSubscription` is called a few minutes later, the promise won't never be resolved. https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/c0757d1d440d6f934436418add9755e7d630bbcf/packages/service-worker/src/push.ts#L93-L99 **Possible solution** Merging `registration`observable with `serviceworker.ready`but I'm not sure if breaks something. https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/c0757d1d440d6f934436418add9755e7d630bbcf/packages/service-worker/src/low_level.ts#L81-L82 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction The problem reproduction is explained in the previous section. But if you want to get crazy to Chrome to test the bug, you can do the following: You can test this on Chrome 72 Windows, the steps are not going to work on Chrome Mac. But I have logs that prove the bug happens in other Chrome version and platforms, maybe, doing different steps, but the state is the same, `serviceworker.controller` is `null`. Steps Chrome Windows. 1. Create a app with a checkbox or switch button to activate/descativate notifications. 2. Check the switch in your app will call `requestSubscription()` 3. When the popup is shown, press Block. 4. Go to de addressbar, click in the lock :lock:. Change the notifications state to Allow. Chrome will say you that the page should be reloaded. 6. Reload the page. 7. If you call `requestSubscription()`again, you won't get the popup. Or if you write in the console `serviceworker.controller` you will get `null`. Here is an example image. The app is started, `serviceworker.controller` is `null`, but I can get the service worker registration and the push subscription, so `serviceworker.controller` is not needed to get it. (Keys are hidden in the image). ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** Tested in angular 7.1.7 but I think all version are affected. **Anything else relevant?** I use this code with a timeout before I run into the issue to avoid freezing the function. I'm getting logs `Can`t subscribe: Timeout ocurred `from Chrome Windows but specially lots of entries for Chrome android. ```typescript this.swPush.requestSubscription({serverPublicKey: this.VAPID_PUBLIC_KEY})) .pipe( timeout(8000), tap({ next: () => this.measuringDao.sendBackendEvent('activated_notifications').subscribe(), error: err => this.logger.warn('Can\'t subscribe: ' + err.toString(), err) }), switchMap(sub => this.notificationsDao.registerPushSubscriber(sub)) ); ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Service worker requestSubscription() freezes and doesn't show native popup if serviceworker.controller is null" (#29067)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): attached flag not being reset when view is destroyed
Issues.Body:
Currently we only reset the `Attached` flag of a view if it is detached through its parent, however this means that if a root view is destroyed, its flag will never be reset. This manifested itself in one of the Material tests where we were destroying the root view.

This PR resolves FW-1130.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): attached flag not being reset when view is destroyed" (#29064)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): correctly evaluate enum references in template expressions
Issues.Body:
The ngtsc partial evaluator previously would not handle an enum reference
inside a template string expression correctly. Enums are resolved to an
`EnumValue` type, which has a `resolved` property with the actual value.

When effectively toString-ing a `ResolvedValue` as part of visiting a
template expression, the partial evaluator needs to translate `EnumValue`s
to their fully resolved value, which this commit does.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): correctly evaluate enum references in template expressions" (#29062)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): replace templateUrl and styleUrls with resolved values in class metadata
Issues.Body:
AOT-compiled components preserve templateUrl and styleUrls values defined in @Component decorator's argument. That is causing problems in TestBed, since we need to have a way of recompiling components in case metadata is changed (as a part of applying overrides in tests). As a result, while recompiling components using JIT compiler, we try to fetch resources again, which is causing errors.

Current solution replaces templateUrl and styleUrls with corresponding resolved values to let JIT recompile components. Moving forward we should replace this with more granular recompilation/updates of component metadata.

This PR resolves FW-1103.


## PR Type

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): copy top-level comments into generated factory shims
Issues.Body:
When ngtsc generates a .ngfactory shim, it does so based on the contents of
an original file in the program. Occasionally these original files have
comments at the top which are load-bearing (e.g. they contain jsdoc
annotations which are significant to downstream bundling tools). The
generated factory shims should preserve this comment.

This commit adds a step to the ngfactory generator to preserve the top-level
comment from the original source file.

FW-1006 #resolve
FW-1095 #resolve
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): copy top-level comments into generated factory shims" (#29065)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): use the imported name of decorators for detection
Issues.Body:
Currently, ngtsc has a bug where if you alias the name of a decorator when
importing it, it won't be detected properly. This is because the compiler
uses the aliased name and not the original, declared name of the decorator
for detection.

This commit fixes the compiler to compare against the declared name of
decorators when available, and adds a test to prevent regression.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): use the imported name of decorators for detection" (#29061)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): track cyclic imports that are added
Issues.Body:
ngtsc has cyclic import detection, to determine when adding an import to a
directive or pipe would create a cycle. However, this detection must also
account for already inserted imports, as it's possible for both directions
of a circular import to be inserted by Ivy (as opposed to at least one of
those edges existing in the user's program).

This commit fixes the circular import detection for components to take into
consideration already added edges.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): move views that are already attached in insert()
Issues.Body:
Currently if a user accidentally calls ViewContainerRef.insert() with
a view that has already been attached, we do not clean up the references
properly, so we create a view tree with a cycle. This causes an infinite
loop when the view is destroyed.

This PR ensures that we fall back to ViewContainerRef.move() behavior
if we try to insert a view that is already attached. This fixes the
cycle and honors the user intention.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): move views that are already attached in insert()" (#29047)

Issues.Title: ngFor memory leak
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Is this a regression?
Don't think so.

### Description

Structure: `AppComponent` , `OneComponent`, `TwoComponent`, `TestService`

`OneComponent` and `TwoComponent` are displayed in `AppComponent` _(only one component is displayed at the same time -> i added button to switch between those components)._

`OneComponent` and `TwoComponent` contains a TemplateRef, when `OneComponent` or `TwoComponent` is created this TemplateRef is added to a `TestService` which is provided by the `AppComponent`.
If `OneComponent` or `TwoComponent` gets destroyed the will remove their TemplateRef from the `TestService`.

TestService: adding / removing a TemplateRef will add remove it to a behaviorSubject (included in TestService).

The `AppComponent` will bind to this behaviorSubject  async.  and display the TemplateRefs.

I added 4 test cases inside the `AppComponent` - template: (just (un)comment to test this test cases)

- Test1 (memory leak):  _ngFor binding with async pipe and displaying the templateRef in templateOutlet_
- Test 2 (memory leak): _ngFor binding an empty ng-container with async pipe, do not display anything_
- Test 3 (no memory leak): _ngIf binding the first element with async pipe, display the templateRef in templateOutlet_
- Test 4 (no memory leak): _binding the first element with async pipe directly to templateOutlet_

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-grux6a

_*this is just a quick implementation to reproduce this "bug", no error checks not a clean code but that was not the point*_

## üî• Exception or Error

Using the browser memory tool (snapshots) shows for Test1 and Test2 that `OneComponent` and `TwoComponent` are still in memory even if they are not displayed.

Expected: `OneComponent` should not be in memory when `TwoComponent` is displayed and vice versa.

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
7.2.5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ngFor memory leak" (#29053)

Issues.Title: fix(common): prevent repeated application of HttpParams mutations
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Previously, an instance of HttpParams would retain its list of mutations
after they have been materialized as a result of a read operation. Not
only does this unnecessarily hold onto memory, more importantly does it
introduce a bug where branching of off a materialized instance would
reconsider the set of mutations that had already been applied, resulting
in repeated application of mutations.

Issue Number: #20430

## What is the new behavior?

This commit fixes the bug by clearing the list of pending mutations
after they have been materialized, such that they will not be considered
once again for branched off instances.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

Alternative to #20610, however this PR keeps the lazy mutation mechanism intact and is therefore much smaller.

/cc @alxhub
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(common): prevent repeated application of HttpParams mutations" (#29045)

Issues.Title: docs(developer): update for the current state of Java SDK licensing
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

We currently list the Java SDK as a [prerequisite](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/docs/DEVELOPER.md#prerequisite-software) in the [Developer Guide](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/docs/DEVELOPER.md). 

We link to the Oracle JDK site in Spanish (http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/es/java/javase/downloads/index.html).

1. It seems like an English site should be the default (http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html)
2. The English site lists Oracle JDK 11.0.2 (LTS) as the top recommendation.

Does Selenium, Bazel, and everything else work with Java 11?
Does it work with the Open JDK 11?

Should we be pointing people at the [Open JDK](https://jdk.java.net/11/) now as the Oracle JDK‚Äôs [Oracle Commercial only license](https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/terms/license/javase-license.html) will likely scare away contributors (and possibly even team‚Äôs considering Angular)?

The Open JDK uses a [GPL v2 license with the Classpath Exception](https://openjdk.java.net/legal/gplv2+ce.html).

Or do we need to specify Java SDK 8?

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/docs/DEVELOPER.md#prerequisite-software

### Reproduction Steps**
Click the link for the "Java Development Kit".

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
It opens the [Oracle JDK site](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/es/java/javase/downloads/index.html) in Spanish. It should open an English site by default and we should consider the Open JDK or specify Java SDK 8.

## üì∑Screenshot
![screen shot 2019-02-28 at 18 20 03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3506071/53605431-7f10b000-3b85-11e9-9239-4d823e089332.png)
![screen shot 2019-02-28 at 18 19 46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3506071/53605435-81730a00-3b85-11e9-8940-8d9bb5385dd8.png)

## üåç  Your Environment

### Browser info
Chrome 72.0.3626.109 (Official Build) (64-bit)

### Anything else relevant?
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èPlease provide additional info if necessary. -->
N/A

Issues.Title: Angular is installed in two different places on Mac and calling the out of date version
Issues.Body:
Hi there,

I created a folder on my users's directory to install all npm packages (I have for example, Ionic 4 installed there).

Then I installed Angular Cli 7 and it went to the correct location in: 
`~/.npm-packages/lib/node_modules/@angular/cli/bin`

When I type: `ng --version` I see the version of the one installed in `/usr/local/bin/ng` which is **1.6.0**

I had to put on my `~/.bash_profile` this:
`export PATH=~/.npm-packages/lib/node_modules/@angular/cli/bin:$PATH`

Then every time I start the computer I have to run on the terminal:
`source ~/.bash_profile`

Otherwise it keeps doing everything with that old version.

I would like to remove that old installation and keep only this one inside `.npm-packages`, how can I do that

Thank you!

üõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõë

Issues.Title: Importing Locally Build Library Inside Another Library Angular v 6
Issues.Body:
While Trying to Import Library Into Another Library I get an Error Cannot Find Module where as the Library is there and Build in Dist Folder.

I have Build 1 Library Say Lib1 it is complied properly using ng build lib1.

When i try to Import any file from Lib1 into Lib2 i am getting error cannot Find Module ..

How to reproduce.

Build a Library 1 and then export all the Files of that Lib 1 that are to be exposed into the public_api.ts .

Add the Lib 1 as dep into Lib2 by adding it into tsconfig.lib.json file .

```
  "compilerOptions": {
    ......
    "paths":{
      "lib1": [
        "dist/lib1"
      ]
    }
  },

```

Add the Deps into Module of Lib2 and components where you want to use it . And build the library you will get the following error.

> Cannot find module 'lib1'.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Importing Locally Build Library Inside Another Library Angular v 6" (#13786)

Issues.Title: No way to get the selected item value out of dynamically created mat-select
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

Being able to get the selected value out of a dynamically created mat-select control with document.getNativeElement or any other way

#### What is the current behavior?

NativeElement created by mat-select does not hold the selected value

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

```
<mat-form-field>
<mat-select id={{column.columnName}} placeholder="{{column.columnName|translate|capitalize}}">
<mat-option *ngFor="let foreignRow of foreignDataMap[getForeignTableName(column.columnName)]" [value]="foreignRow.uid">
 {{foreignRow.value}}
</mat-option>
</mat-select>
</mat-form-field>
```

```
var element = document.getElementById( column.columnName ) as HTMLInputElement;

element.value <-- does not exist
```

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

All latest.

#### Is there anything else we should know?

No.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "No way to get the selected item value out of dynamically created mat-select" (#15341)

Issues.Title: fix(virtual-scroll): move views that are already attached instead of inserting
Issues.Body:
This PR does two things:

1) Fixes a minor issue in `CdkVirtualScroll` where sometimes views were inserted twice.

2) Fixes some tests that were relying on the fact that an externally requested `ViewContainerRef` would be the same instance as the injected `ViewContainerRef` instance (specifically `spyOn` methods were spying on a different instance). This is an implementation detail that is changed in Ivy.  Also fixes these tests so that they aren't spying directly on `ViewContainerRef` method calls (as these are also called internally by `ViewContainerRef` itself and could change at any time).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(virtual-scroll): move views that are already attached instead of inserting" (#15348)

Issues.Title: fix(virtual-scroll): move views that are already attached instead of inserting
Issues.Body:
This PR does three things:

1) Marks a query as static in `CdkVirtualScrollViewport`

2) Fixes some tests that were relying on the fact that an externally requested `ViewContainerRef` would be the same instance as the injected `ViewContainerRef` instance (specifically `spyOn` methods were spying on a different instance). This is an implementation detail that is changed in Ivy.  Also fixes these tests so that they aren't spying directly on `ViewContainerRef` method calls (as these are also called internally by `ViewContainerRef` itself and could change at any time).

3) Fixes a minor issue in `CdkVirtualScroll` where sometimes views were inserted twice.

Issues.Title: Focus escapes from mat-dialog with mat-chip-list
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Focus stays within the dialog.

#### What is the current behavior?
Focus moves out of the dialog.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Reproduction on StackBlitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-yqbcay
1. Open a dialog that contains a mat-chip list
2. Remove the last chip eg. with backspace
3. The focus is outside of the dialog.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
 OS: Linux
 Browser: Chrome 72.0.3626.119 (Official Build) (64-bit)
 package versions:
     "@angular/core": "6.1.9",
     "@angular/material": "^7.3.3",
     "typescript": "~2.7.2"

#### Is there anything else we should know?

- The focus moves back for Tab key.
- The focus moves out of the dialog, if the focused tag is removed differently from the DOM.
- It seems that the [FocusTrap](https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/src/cdk/a11y/focus-trap/focus-trap.ts) does not handle this case.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Focus escapes from mat-dialog with mat-chip-list" (#15338)
